original: oṃ devā ha vai svargalokam āyaṃs te rudram apṛcchan ko bhavān iti /
analyzed: om devāḥ ha vai svarga lokam āyan te rudram apṛcchan kaḥ bhavān iti
translated: Om. The gods indeed went to the heavenly world. They asked Rudra, Who are you?

original: so 'bravīd aham ekaḥ prathamam āsodvartāmi ca bhaviṣyāmi ca nānyaḥ kaścin matto vyatirikta iti /
analyzed: saḥ bravīt aham ekaḥ prathamam āsa udvartāmi ca bhaviṣyāmi ca na anyaḥ kaścid mattaḥ vyatiriktaḥ iti
translated: He said, I alone was the first, I will be in the future, and there is no one else besides me.

original: so 'ntarād antaraṃ prāviśat diśaś cāntaraṃ prāviśat so 'haṃ nityānityo vyaktāvyakto
analyzed: saḥ ntarāt antaram prāviśat diśaḥ ca antaram prāviśat saḥ ham nitya anityaḥ vyakta avyaktaḥ
translated: He entered from within, and entered the directions from within. I am eternal and non-eternal, manifest and unmanifest,

original: brahmā brahmāhaṃ prāñcaḥ pratyañco 'haṃ dakṣiṇāṃ ca udañco 'ham adhaś cordhvaś cāhaṃ
analyzed: brahmā brahmā aham prāñcaḥ pratyañcaḥ ham dakṣiṇām ca udañcaḥ ham adhas ca ūrdhvaḥ ca aham
translated: Brahma, I am Brahma. I am the east, the west, the south, the north, below and above,

original: diśaś ca pratidiśaś cāhaṃ pumān apumān striyaś cāhaṃ sāvitry ahaṃ gāyatry ahaṃ triṣṭubjagatyanuṣṭup
analyzed: diśaḥ ca pratidiśaḥ ca aham pumān a pumān striyaḥ ca aham sāvitrī aham gāyatrī aham triṣṭubh jagatī anuṣṭubh
translated: I am the directions and the intermediate directions. I am the male, the neuter, and the female. I am Savitri, I am Gayatri, I am Tristubh, Jagati, and Anustubh,

original: cāhaṃ chando 'haṃ satyo 'haṃ gārhapatyo dakṣiṇāgnir āhavanīyo 'haṃ gaur ahaṃ gaury
analyzed: ca aham chandaḥ ham satyaḥ ham gārhapatyaḥ dakṣiṇāgniḥ āhavanīyaḥ ham gauḥ aham gaurī
translated: I am the meter. I am truth. I am the Garhapatya fire, the Dakshina fire, and the Ahavaniya fire. I am the cow, I am the cow

original: aham ṛg ahaṃ yajur ahaṃ sāmāham atharvāṅgiraso 'haṃ jyeṣṭho 'haṃ śreṣṭho'haṃ variṣṭho
analyzed: aham ṛc aham yajuḥ aham sāma aham atharva aṅgirasaḥ ham jyeṣṭhaḥ ham śreṣṭhaḥ ham variṣṭhaḥ
translated: I am the Rig Veda, I am the Yajur Veda, I am the Sama Veda, I am the Atharva Veda. I am the eldest, I am the best, I am the most excellent,

original: 'ham āpo 'haṃ tejo 'haṃ guhyo 'ham araṇyo 'ham akṣaram ahaṃ kṣaram ahaṃ puṣkaram
analyzed: ham āpaḥ ham tejaḥ ham guhyaḥ ham araṇyaḥ ham akṣaram aham kṣaram aham puṣkaram
translated: I am the waters, I am the light, I am the secret, I am the sacred fire, I am the imperishable, I am the perishable, I am the lotus.

original: ahaṃ pavitram aham ugraṃ ca baliś ca purastāj jyotir ity aham eva sarvebhyo mām eva
analyzed: aham pavitram aham ugram ca baliḥ ca purastāt jyotiḥ iti aham eva sarvebhyaḥ mām eva
translated: I am the pure one, I am the fierce one, and the oblation, the light in front, I alone am all, I alone am the one to be known by all.

original: sa sarvaḥ samāyo māṃ veda sa devān veda sarvāṃś ca vedān sāṅgān api brahma brāhmaṇaiś
analyzed: sa sarvaḥ samāyaḥ mām veda sa devān veda sarvān ca vedān sa aṅgān api brahma brāhmaṇaiḥ
translated: He who knows me as all-pervading, he knows the gods and all the Vedas with their limbs, and also Brahman with the Brahmanas,

original: ca gāṃ gobhir brāhmaṇān brāhmaṇyena havir haviṣā āyur āyuṣā satyena satyaṃ dharmeṇa
analyzed: ca gām gobhiḥ brāhmaṇān brāhmaṇyena haviḥ haviṣā āyuḥ āyuṣā satyena satyam dharmeṇa
translated: the cow with cows, the Brahmanas with Brahminhood, the oblation with oblation, life with life, truth with truth, and Dharma

original: dharmaṃ tarpayāmi svena tejasā /
analyzed: dharmam tarpayāmi svena tejasā
translated: with Dharma. I gratify him with my own splendor.

original: tato ha vai te devā rudram apṛcchan te devā rudram apaśyan te devā rudram adhyāyan te devā ūrdhvabāhavo rudraṃ stuvanti //
analyzed: tatas ha vai te devāḥ rudram apṛcchan te devāḥ rudram apaśyan te devāḥ rudram adhyāyan te devāḥ ūrdhvabāhavaḥ rudram stuvanti sirup
translated: Then indeed the gods asked Rudra. The gods saw Rudra. The gods studied with Rudra. The gods praise Rudra with uplifted arms.

original: oṃ yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca brahmā tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: om yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca brahmā tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup
translated: Om. He who is Rudra, he is the Lord, and he who is Brahma, to him indeed salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca viṣṇus tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca skandas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca viṣṇuḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca skandaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Lord, and he who is Vishnu, to him indeed salutations again and again.🔽He who is Rudra, he is the Lord, and he who is Skanda, to him indeed salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś cendras tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca indraḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Lord, and he who is Indra, to him indeed salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś cāgnis tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca vāyus tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca agniḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca vāyuḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Agni, to him be salutations again and again.🔽He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Vayu, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavan yaś ca sūryas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavan yaḥ ca sūryaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Surya, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca somas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān ye cāṣṭau grahās tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca somaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ sirup  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān ye ca aṣṭau grahāḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Soma, to him be salutations again and again.🔽He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is the eight Grahas, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān ye cāṣṭau pratigrahās tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca bhūs tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān ye ca aṣṭau pratigrahāḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca bhūḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is the eight Pratigrahas, to him be salutations again and again.🔽He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Bhu, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca bhuvas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca bhuvaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Bhuva, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca svas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca svar tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Sva, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca mahas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca mahaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is Maha, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yā ca pṛthivī tasmai vai namonamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yā ca pṛthivī tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, he is the Blessed One, and he who is the earth, to him be salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac cāntarikṣaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca antarikṣam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the space between heaven and earth, to him be homage, homage!

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yā ca dyaus tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yāś cāpas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yā ca dyauḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yāḥ ca apaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the heaven, to him be homage, homage!🔽He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the waters, to him be homage, homage!

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca tejas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca kālas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca tejaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca kālaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the fire, to him be homage, homage!🔽He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the time, to him be homage, homage!

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca yamas tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaś ca mṛtyus tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca yamaḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yaḥ ca mṛtyuḥ tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the Yama, to him be homage, homage!🔽He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the death, to him be homage, homage!

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac cāmṛtaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac cākāśaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca viśvaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca amṛtam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca ākāśam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca viśvam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the nectar, to him be homage, homage!🔽He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the space, to him be homage, homage!🔽He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the universe, to him be homage, homage!

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca sthūlaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca sthūlam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and the gross, to him be homage, homage!

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca sūkṣmaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca sūkṣmam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and that which is subtle, to him I offer salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca śuklaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //🔽yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca kṛṣṇaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca śuklam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ  yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca kṛṣṇam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and that which is white, to him I offer salutations again and again.🔽He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and that which is black, to him I offer salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca kṛtsnaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca kṛtsnam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and that which is complete, to him I offer salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca satyaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca satyam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and that which is true, to him I offer salutations again and again.

original: yo vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yac ca sarvaṃ tasmai vai namonamaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vai rudraḥ sa bhagavān yat ca sarvam tasmai vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: He who is Rudra, that is the Blessed One, and that which is all, to him I offer salutations again and again.

original: bhas te ādir madhyaṃ bhuvas te svas te śīrṣaṃ viśvarūpo 'si brahmaikas tvaṃ dvidhā
analyzed: bhaḥ te ādiḥ madhyam bhuvaḥ te svar te śīrṣam viśva rūpaḥ si brahmā ekaḥ tvam dvidhā
translated: You are the beginning and middle of the ashes, you are the earth, you are the head, you are the all-formed, you are the one Brahman, you are twofold,

original: tridhā vṛddhis tvaṃ śāntis tvaṃ puṣṭis tvaṃ hutam ahutaṃ dattam adattaṃ sarvam asarvaṃ
analyzed: tridhā vṛddhiḥ tvam śāntiḥ tvam puṣṭiḥ tvam hutam ahutam dattam adattam sarvam asarvam
translated: you are threefold, you are the growth, you are the peace, you are the nourishment, you are the offered, the unoffered, the given, the ungiven, the all, the non-all,

original: viśvam aviśvaṃ kṛtam akṛtaṃ param aparaṃ parāyaṇaṃ ca tvam /
analyzed: viśvam a viśvam kṛtam a kṛtam param aparam parāyaṇam ca tvam
translated: you are the created, the uncreated, the supreme, the inferior, and the ultimate resort.

original: apām asomam amṛtā abhūm āgan me jyotir avidāma devān /
analyzed: apām asomam amṛtā abhūm āgan me jyotiḥ avidāma devān
translated: I have become immortal by the nectar of the waters, the light has come to me, I have known the gods.

original: kiṃ nūnam asmān kṛṇavad arātiḥ /
analyzed: kim nūnam asmān kṛṇavat arātiḥ
translated: What harm has it done to us?

original: kim u dhūrtir amṛtaṃ martyasya somasūryapurastāt sūkṣmaḥ puruṣaḥ /
analyzed: kim u dhūrtiḥ amṛtam martyasya soma sūrya purastāt sūkṣmaḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: What to speak of the subtle Purusha who is in front of Soma and Surya, the immortal one who is the support of the mortal one.

original: sarvaṃ jagaddhitaṃ vā etad akṣaraṃ prājāpatyaṃ saumyaṃ sūkṣmaṃ puruṣaṃ grāhyam aguhyena🔽bhāvaṃ bhāvena saumyaṃ saumyena sūkṣmaṃ sūkṣmena vāyavyaṃ vāyavyena grasati tasmai
analyzed: sarvam jagat hitam vai etat akṣaram prājāpatyam saumyam sūkṣmam puruṣam grāhyam a guhyena  bhāvam bhāvena saumyam saumyena sūkṣmam sūkṣmena vāyavyam vāyavyena grasati tasmai
translated: This beneficial syllable, which is the subtle Purusha related to Prajapati, Soma, and the subtle one, should be grasped by the one who is not hidden.🔽By the subtle one, he swallows the subtle one related to Vayu. To that great devourer,

original: mahāgrāsāya vai namonamaḥ /
analyzed: mahāgrāsāya vai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: salutations again and again.

original: hṛdisthā devatāḥ sarvā hṛdi prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ /
analyzed: hṛdisthāḥ devatāḥ sarvāḥ hṛdi prāṇāḥ pratiṣṭhitāḥ
translated: All the deities reside in the heart, the vital airs are established in the heart.

original: hṛdi tvam asi yo nityaṃ tisro mātrāḥ paras tu saḥ //
analyzed: hṛdi tvam asi yaḥ nityam tisraḥ mātrāḥ paraḥ tu saḥ
translated: You are in the heart, O eternal one, he is beyond the three measures.

original: tasyottarataḥ śirodakṣiṇataḥ pādau ya uttarataḥ sa oṃkāraḥ ya oṃkāraḥ sa praṇavaḥ
analyzed: tasya uttaratas śiraḥ dakṣiṇatas pādau yaḥ uttaratas saḥ oṃkāraḥ yaḥ oṃkāraḥ sa praṇavaḥ
translated: His head is in the north, his feet in the south. What is in the north is the syllable Om. What is the syllable Om is the Pranava.

original: yaḥ praṇavaḥ sa sarvavyāpī yaḥ sarvavyāpī so 'nantaḥ yo 'nantas tat tāraṃ yat tāraṃ🔽tac chuklaṃ yac chuklaṃ tat sūkṣmaṃ yat sūkṣmaṃ tad vaidyutaṃ yad vaidyutaṃ tat paraṃ
analyzed: yaḥ praṇavaḥ sa sarvavyāpī yaḥ sarvavyāpī saḥ nantaḥ yaḥ nantaḥ tat tāram yat tāram  tat śuklam yat śuklam tat sūkṣmam yat sūkṣmam tat vaidyutam yat vaidyutam tat param
translated: What is the Pranava is all-pervading. What is all-pervading is Ananta. What is Ananta is the Tara. What is the Tara

original: brahma yat paraṃ brahma sa ekaḥ yaḥ ekaḥ sa rudraḥ yo rudraḥ sa īśānaḥ ya īśānaḥ
analyzed: brahma yat param brahma saḥ ekaḥ yaḥ ekaḥ sa rudraḥ yaḥ rudraḥ saḥ īśānaḥ yaḥ īśānaḥ
translated: is white. What is white is subtle. What is subtle is the lightning. What is the lightning is the supreme Brahman. What is the supreme Brahman is the one. Who is the one is Rudra. Who is Rudra is Isana. Who is Isana🔽is the one.

original: sa bhagavān maheśvaraḥ //
analyzed: sa bhagavān maheśvaraḥ
translated: That Blessed Lord is Mahesvara.

original: atha kasmād ucyate oṃkāraḥ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva prāṇān ūrdhvam utkrāmayati tasmād ucyate oṃkāraḥ /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate oṃkāraḥ yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva prāṇān ūrdhvam utkrāmayati tasmāt ucyate oṃkāraḥ
translated: Now, why is it called Om? Because when uttered, it causes the vital breaths to ascend upwards, therefore it is called Om.

original: atha kasmād ucyate praṇavaḥ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva ṛgyajuḥsāmātharvāṅgirasaṃ brahma brāhmaṇebhyaḥ praṇāmayati nāmayati ca tasmād ucyate praṇavaḥ
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate praṇavaḥ yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva ṛk yajuḥ sāma atharva aṅgirasam brahma brāhmaṇebhyaḥ praṇāmayati nāmayati ca tasmāt ucyate praṇavaḥ
translated: Now, why is it called Pranava? Because when uttered, it causes the Rg, Yajus, Sama, Atharva-Angirasa, and Brahman to bow down and incline towards the Brahmanas, therefore it is called Pranava.

original: atha kasmād ucyate sarvavyāpī yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva yathā snehena palalapiṇḍam iva śāntarūpam otaprotam anuprāpto vyatiṣaktaś ca tasmād ucyate
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate sarvavyāpī yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva yathā snehena palala piṇḍam iva śānta rūpam otaprotam anuprāptaḥ vyatiṣaktaḥ ca tasmāt ucyate
translated: Now, why is it called all-pervading? Because when uttered, it is like a lump of oil-cake, with its form pacified, it is obtained and interwoven, and mixed up, therefore it is called

original: sarvavyāpī /🔽atha kasmād ucyate 'nantaḥ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva tiryag ūrdhvam adhastāc cāsyānto nopalabhyate tasmād ucyate 'nantaḥ /
analyzed: sarvavyāpī  atha kasmāt ucyate nantaḥ yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva tiryak ūrdhvam adhastāt ca asya antaḥ na upalabhyate tasmāt ucyate nantaḥ
translated: all-pervading.🔽Now, why is it called infinite? Because when uttered, its end is not perceived horizontally, upwards, or downwards, therefore it is called infinite.

original: atha kasmād ucyate tāraṃ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva garbhajanmavyādhijarāmaraṇasaṃsāramahābhayāt tārayati trāyate ca tasmād ucyate tāram /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate tāram yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva garbha janma vyādhi jarā maraṇa saṃsāra mahā bhayāt tārayati trāyate ca tasmāt ucyate tāram
translated: Now, why is it called Tara? Because when uttered, it delivers and protects from the great fear of the world of rebirth, birth, old age, disease, and death, therefore it is called Tara.

original: atha kasmād ucyate śuklaṃ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva klandate klāmayati ca tasmād ucyate śuklam /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate śuklam yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva klāmayati ca tasmāt ucyate śuklam
translated: Now, why is it called 'white'? Because when uttered, it shines and delights, therefore it is called 'white'.

original: atha kasmād ucyate sūkṣmaṃ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva sūkṣmo bhūtvā śarīrāṇy adhitiṣṭhati sarvāṇi cāṅgāny abhimṛśati tasmād ucyate sūkṣmam /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate sūkṣmam yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva sūkṣmaḥ bhūtvā śarīrāṇi adhitiṣṭhati sarvāṇi ca aṅgāni abhimṛśati tasmāt ucyate sūkṣmam
translated: Now, why is it called 'subtle'? Because when uttered, it becomes subtle and pervades all the bodies and touches all the limbs, therefore it is called 'subtle'.

original: atha kasmād ucyate vaidyutaṃ yasmād uccāryamāṇa eva vyakte mahati tamasi dyotayati tasmād ucyate vaidyutam /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate vaidyutam yasmāt uccāryamāṇaḥ eva vyakte mahati tamasi dyotayati tasmāt ucyate vaidyutam
translated: Now, why is it called 'lightning'? Because when uttered, it illuminates in the great darkness, therefore it is called 'lightning'.

original: atha kasmād ucyate paraṃ brahma yasmāt param aparaṃ parāyaṇaṃ ca bṛhad bṛhatyā bṛṃhayati tasmād ucyate paraṃ brahma /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate param brahma yasmāt param aparam parāyaṇam ca bṛhat bṛhatyā bṛṃhayati tasmāt ucyate param brahma
translated: Now, why is it called 'supreme Brahman'? Because it is the supreme, the highest, the ultimate support, and it expands the great with the great, therefore it is called 'supreme Brahman'.

original: atha kasmād ucyate ekaḥ yaḥ sarvān prāṇān saṃbhakṣya saṃbhakṣaṇenājaḥ saṃsṛjati visṛjati
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate ekaḥ yaḥ sarvān prāṇān saṃbhakṣya saṃbhakṣaṇena ajaḥ saṃsṛjati visṛjati
translated: Now, why is it called 'one'? Because it, the unborn, having devoured all the vital airs, creates and emits them by eating,

original: tīrtham eke vrajanti tīrtham eke dakṣiṇāḥ pratyañca udañcaḥ prāñco 'bhivrajanty eke
analyzed: tīrtham eke vrajanti tīrtham eke dakṣiṇāḥ pratyañcaḥ udañcaḥ prāñcaḥ bhivrajanti eke
translated: Some go to holy places, some go to the south, west, north, and east.

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣām iha saṃgatiḥ /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām iha saṃgatiḥ
translated: The meeting of all of them is here.

original: sākaṃ sa eko bhūtaś carati prajānāṃ tasmād ucyate ekaḥ /
analyzed: sākam saḥ ekaḥ bhūtaḥ carati prajānām tasmāt ucyate ekaḥ
translated: He moves alone with the one existent being of creatures. Therefore, he is called Eka.

original: atha kasmād ucyate rudraḥ yasmād ṛṣibhir nānyair bhaktair drutam asya rūpam upalabhyate tasmād ucyate rudraḥ /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate rudraḥ yasmāt ṛṣibhiḥ na anyaiḥ bhaktaiḥ drutam asya rūpam upalabhyate tasmāt ucyate rudraḥ
translated: Now, why is he called Rudra? Because his form is quickly perceived by the sages and other devotees, not by others. Therefore, he is called Rudra.

original: atha kasmād ucyate īśānaḥ yaḥ sarvān devān īśate īśānībhir jananībhiś ca śaktibhiḥ /
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate īśānaḥ yaḥ sarvān devān īśate īśānībhiḥ jananībhiḥ ca śaktibhiḥ
translated: Now, why is he called Isana? He who rules over all the gods and the powerful mothers who give birth.

original: abhittvā śūraṇo numo dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ /
analyzed: a bhittvā śūraṇaḥ dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ
translated: Without piercing, we praise the one who is like milked cows.

original: īśānam asya jagataḥ svadarśam īśānam indratasthuṣa iti tasmād ucyate īśānaḥ /
analyzed: īśānam asya jagataḥ sva darśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ iti tasmāt ucyate īśānaḥ
translated: The self-manifest lord of this world, the lord who stands in the abode of Indra. Therefore, he is called Isana.

original: atha kasmād ucyate bhagavān maheśvaraḥ yasmād bhaktājñānena bhajaty anugṛhṇāti ca
analyzed: atha kasmāt ucyate bhagavān maheśvaraḥ yasmāt bhakta ajñānena bhajati anugṛhṇāti ca
translated: Now, why is he called the Blessed Lord Mahesvara? Because he worships and favors with the knowledge of his devotees,

original: vācaṃ saṃsṛjati visṛjati ca sarvān bhāvān parityajyātmajñānena yogaiśvaryeṇa mahati
analyzed: vācam saṃsṛjati visṛjati ca sarvān bhāvān parityajya ātma jñānena yoga aiśvaryeṇa mahati
translated: and creates and destroys all beings by abandoning them with the lordship of yoga through the knowledge of the self.

original: mahīyate tasmād ucyate bhagavān maheśvaraḥ tad etad rudracaritam //
analyzed: mahīyate tasmāt ucyate bhagavān maheśvaraḥ tat etat rudra caritam
translated: He is glorified. Therefore, he is called the Blessed Lord Mahesvara. This is the conduct of Rudra.

original: eko ha devaḥ pradiśo 'nu sarvāḥ pūrvo ha jātaḥ sa u garbha antaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ ha devaḥ pradiśaḥ nu sarvāḥ pūrvaḥ ha jātaḥ saḥ u garbha antaḥ
translated: The one god pervades all the directions. He was born first, and he is within the womb.

original: sa eva jātaḥ sa janiṣyamāṇaḥ pratyaṅjanās tiṣṭhati sarvatomukhaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva jātaḥ sa janiṣyamāṇaḥ pratyaṅ janāḥ tiṣṭhati sarvatomukhaḥ
translated: He alone is born, he is being born, he stands with all faces towards all people.

original: eko rudro na dvitīyāya tasmai ya imāṃl lokān īśata īśānībhiḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ rudraḥ na dvitīyāya tasmai yaḥ imān lokān īśate īśānībhiḥ
translated: Rudra is one, not a second to him, who rules over these worlds with his powers of lordship.

original: pratyaṅjanās tiṣṭhati saṃcukocāntakāle saṃsṛjya viśvā bhuvanāni goptā /
analyzed: pratyaṅ janāḥ tiṣṭhati saṃcukoca antakāle saṃsṛjya viśvā bhuvanāni goptā
translated: He stands with all faces, contracted at the end of time, the protector who has created all beings.

original: yo yoniṃ yonim adhitiṣṭhaty eko yenedaṃ sarvaṃ vicarati sarvam /
analyzed: yaḥ yonim yonim adhitiṣṭhati ekaḥ yena idam sarvam vicarati sarvam
translated: The one who dwells in every womb, by whom all this moves, all this universe,

original: tam īśānaṃ varadaṃ devam īḍyaṃ nicāyyemāṃ śāntim atyantam eti /
analyzed: tam īśānam vara dam devam īḍyam nicāyya imām śāntim atyantam eti
translated: having meditated on that Lord, the giver of boons, the adorable God, one attains this peace forever.

original: kṣamāṃ hitvā hetujālasya mūlaṃ buddhyā saṃcitaṃ sthāpayitvā tu rudro rudram ekatvam āhuḥ /
analyzed: kṣamām hitvā hetu jālasya mūlam buddhyā saṃcitam sthāpayitvā tu rudraḥ rudram ekatvam āhuḥ
translated: Having abandoned forgiveness, the root of the net of causes, having placed it with the intellect, Rudra is said to be of one nature with Rudra.

original: śāśvataṃ vai purāṇam iṣam ūrjeṇa paśavo 'nunāmayantaṃ mṛtyupāśān /
analyzed: śāśvatam vai purāṇam iṣam ūrjeṇa paśavaḥ nunāmayantam mṛtyu pāśān
translated: The eternal ancient food, the cattle follow for strength, the snares of death.

original: tad etenātmann etenārdhacaturthena mātreṇa śāntiṃ saṃsṛjati paśupāśavimokṣaṇam yā sā prathamā mātrā brahmadevatyā raktā varṇena yas tāṃ dhyāyate
analyzed: tat etena ātman etena ardhacaturthena mātreṇa śāntim saṃsṛjati paśu pāśa vimokṣaṇam yā sā prathamā mātrā brahma devatyā raktā varṇena yaḥ tām dhyāyate
translated: By this half-verse, the fourth, he creates peace in the self, the liberation of the bonds of cattle, that first syllable, which has Brahman as its deity, is red in color. He who always meditates on it

original: nityaṃ sa gacched brahmapadam /
analyzed: nityam sa gacchet brahma padam
translated: would go to the state of Brahman.

original: yā sā dvitīyā mātrā viṣṇudevatyā kṛṣṇā varṇena yas tāṃ dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacched vaiṣṇavaṃ padam /
analyzed: yā sā dvitīyā mātrā viṣṇu devatyā kṛṣṇā varṇena yaḥ tām dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet vaiṣṇavam padam
translated: That second syllable, which is dedicated to the god Vishnu, is black in color. One who always meditates on it goes to the abode of Vishnu.

original: yā sā tṛtīyā mātrā īśānadevatyā kapilā varṇena yas tāṃ dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacched aiśānaṃ padam /
analyzed: yā sā tṛtīyā mātrā īśāna devatyā kapilā varṇena yaḥ tām dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet aiśānam padam
translated: That third syllable, which is dedicated to the god Ishana, is tawny in color. One who always meditates on it goes to the abode of Ishana.

original: yā sārdhacaturthī mātrā sarvadevatyāvyaktībhūtā khaṃ vicarati śuddhā sphaṭikasaṃnibhā varṇena yas tāṃ dhyāyate nityaṃ sa gacchet padam anāmayam
analyzed: yā sārdhacaturthī mātrā sarva devatyā avyaktībhūtā kham vicarati śuddhā sphaṭika saṃnibhā varṇena yaḥ tām dhyāyate nityam sa gacchet padam anāmayam
translated: That fourth and a half syllable, which is dedicated to all the gods and has become unmanifest, moves in the sky, pure, and is similar in color to a crystal. One who always meditates on it goes to the abode of the diseaseless.

original: tad etad upāsīta munayo vāgvadanti na tasya grahaṇam ayaṃ panthā vihita uttareṇa yena devā yānti yena pitaro yena ṛṣayaḥ param aparaṃ parāyaṇaṃ
analyzed: tat etat upāsīta munayaḥ vāc vadanti na tasya grahaṇam ayam panthāḥ vihitaḥ uttareṇa yena devāḥ yānti yena pitaraḥ yena ṛṣayaḥ param aparam parāyaṇam
translated: The sages worship that and speak of it. It is not grasped. This is the path laid out to the north, by which the gods go, by which the ancestors go, by which the sages go, the supreme and the inferior, the ultimate resort.

original: ceti //
analyzed: ca iti
translated: Thus.

original: bālāgramātraṃ hṛdayasya madhye viśvaṃ devaṃ jātarūpaṃ vareṇyam /
analyzed: bālāgra mātram hṛdayasya madhye viśvam devam jātarūpam vareṇyam
translated: The god of the universe, of the form of gold, is in the middle of the heart, the size of the tip of a hair.

original: tam ātmasthaṃ ye tu paśyanti dhīrās teṣāṃ śāntir bhavati netareṣām //
analyzed: tam ātma stham ye tu paśyanti dhīrāḥ teṣām śāntiḥ bhavati na itareṣām
translated: Those wise ones who see him residing in the self, for them there is peace, not for others.

original: yasmin krodhaṃ yāṃ ca tṛṣṇāṃ kṣamāṃ cākṣamāṃ hitvā hetujālasya mūlam /
analyzed: yasmin krodham yām ca tṛṣṇām kṣamām ca akṣamām hitvā hetu jālasya mūlam
translated: In whom, having abandoned anger, desire, forgiveness, and lack of forgiveness, the root of the net of causes,

original: buddhyā saṃcitaṃ sthāpayitvā tu rudre rudram ekatvam āhuḥ //
analyzed: buddhyā saṃcitam sthāpayitvā tu rudre rudram eka tvam āhuḥ
translated: Having collected it with the mind, they say Rudra is one with Rudra.

original: rudro hi śāśvatena vai purāṇeneṣam ūrjeṇa tapasā niyantāgnir iti bhasma vāyar iti
analyzed: rudraḥ hi śāśvatena vai purāṇena iṣam ūrjeṇa tapasā niyantā agniḥ iti bhasma iti
translated: For Rudra, with his eternal, ancient, powerful austerity, is the controller. Fire is ashes, wind is ashes,

original: bhasma jalam iti bhasma sthalam iti bhasma vyomam iti bhasma sarvaṃ ha vā idaṃ bhasma
analyzed: bhasma jalam iti bhasma sthalam iti bhasma vyomam iti bhasma sarvam ha vai idam bhasma
translated: water is ashes, land is ashes, the sky is ashes. Everything here is indeed ashes.

original: mana etāni cakṣūṃṣi yasmād vratam idaṃ pāśupataṃ yad bhasmanāṅgāni saṃspṛśet tasmād
analyzed: manaḥ etāni cakṣūṃṣi yasmāt vratam idam pāśupatam yat bhasmanā aṅgāni saṃspṛśet tasmāt
translated: The mind is the eyes. Since this Paśupata vow is to touch the limbs with ashes, therefore

original: brahma tad etat pāśupataṃ paśupāśavimokṣaṇāya //
analyzed: brahma tat etat pāśupatam paśu pāśa vimokṣaṇāya
translated: that Brahman is this Paśupata, for the liberation of the fettered from the bonds of the fettered.

original: yo 'gnau rudro yo 'psv antar ya oṣadhīr vīrudha āviveśa /
analyzed: yaḥ gnau rudraḥ yaḥ psu antar yaḥ oṣadhīḥ vīrudhaḥ āviveśa
translated: The Rudra who is in the fire, who is in the waters, who has entered the plants and trees,

original: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni caklape tasmai rudrāya namo 'stv agnaye /
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni caklape tasmai rudrāya namaḥ stu agnaye
translated: to that Rudra who has created all these worlds, homage to Agni.

original: yo rudro 'gnau yo rudro 'psv antar yo rudra oṣadhīr vīrudha āviveśa /
analyzed: yaḥ rudraḥ gnau yaḥ rudraḥ u psu antar yaḥ rudraḥ oṣadhīḥ vīrudhaḥ āviveśa
translated: The Rudra who is in the fire, who is in the waters, who is in the plants and trees,

original: yo rudra imā viśvā bhuvanāni caklape tasmai rudrāya namonamaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ rudraḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni caklape tasmai rudrāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: to that Rudra who has created all these worlds, homage to Rudra.

original: yo rudro 'psu yo rudra oṣadhiṣu yo rudro vanaspatiṣu /
analyzed: yaḥ rudraḥ u psu yaḥ rudraḥ oṣadhiṣu yaḥ rudraḥ vanaspatiṣu
translated: The Rudra who is in the waters, who is in the plants, who is in the trees,

original: yena rudreṇa jagad ūrdhvaṃ dhāritaṃ pṛthivī dvidhā tridhā dhartā dhāritā nāgā ye 'ntarikṣe tasmai rudrāya vai namonamaḥ /🔽mūrdhānam asya saṃsevyāpy atharvā hṛdayaṃ ca yat /
analyzed: yena rudreṇa jagat ūrdhvam dhāritam pṛthivī dvidhā tridhā dhartā dhāritāḥ nāgāḥ ye ntarikṣe tasmai rudrāya vai namaḥ namaḥ  mūrdhānam asya saṃsevya api atharvā hṛdayam ca yat
translated: To that Rudra who holds the world above, who divides the earth in two and three, who holds the serpents in the atmosphere, salutations again and again to that Rudra.🔽Having served his head and heart, Atharva

original: mastiṣkād ūrdhvaṃ prerayaty avamāno 'dhiśīrṣataḥ //
analyzed: mastiṣkāt ūrdhvam prerayati avamānaḥ dhi śīrṣataḥ
translated: drives it upwards from the brain, the contempt above the head.

original: tad vā atharvaṇaḥ śiro devakośaḥ samujjhitaḥ /
analyzed: tat vai atharvaṇaḥ śiraḥ deva kośaḥ samujjhitaḥ
translated: That is the head of Atharva, the treasure of the gods, abandoned.

original: tat prāṇo 'bhirakṣati śiro 'ntam atho manaḥ /
analyzed: tat prāṇaḥ bhirakṣati śiraḥ ntam atha u manaḥ
translated: That life protects the head and the mind.

original: na ca divo devajanena guptā na cāntarikṣāṇi na ca bhūma imāḥ yasminn idaṃ sarvam otaprotaṃ tasmād anyaṃ na paraṃ kiṃca nāsti //
analyzed: na ca divaḥ deva janena guptāḥ na ca antarikṣāṇi na ca imāḥ yasmin idam sarvam otaprotam tasmāt anyam na param kiṃca na asti  /
translated: Not protected by the people of heaven, not the spaces, not these earths, in which all this is woven together, from that there is nothing else higher.

original: na tasmāt pūrvaṃ na paraṃ tad asti na bhūtaṃ nota bhavyaṃ yad āsīt /
analyzed: na tasmāt pūrvam na param tat asti na bhūtam na uta bhavyam yat āsīt
translated: There is nothing before that, nothing after that, nothing that was, nor what will be.

original: sahasrapād ekamūrdhnā vyāptaṃ sa evedam āvarīvartti bhūtam //
analyzed: sahasra pād eka mūrdhnā vyāptam saḥ eva idam āvarīvarti bhūtam
translated: With a thousand feet, one head, pervading, he alone moves this created world.

original: akṣarāt saṃjāyate kālaḥ kālād vyāpaka ucyate //
analyzed: akṣarāt saṃjāyate kālaḥ kālāt vyāpakaḥ ucyate
translated: From the imperishable, time is born, from time, the all-pervading is said.

original: vyāpako hi bhagavān rudro bhogāyamāno yadā śete rudras tadā saṃhāryyate prajāḥ /
analyzed: vyāpakaḥ hi bhagavān rudraḥ bhogāyamānaḥ yadā śete rudraḥ tadā prajāḥ
translated: For the all-pervading Lord Rudra, when lying down for enjoyment, then the creatures are withdrawn by Rudra.

original: ucchvasite tamo bhavati tamasa āpo 'psv aṅgulyā mathite mathitaṃ śiśire śiśiraṃ mathyamānaṃ
analyzed: ucchvasite tamaḥ bhavati tamasaḥ āpaḥ psu aṅgulyā mathite mathitam śiśire śiśiram mathyamānam
translated: When it breathes, darkness arises. From darkness, water. From water, when churned with the fingers, cold. From cold, when churned,

original: phenaṃ bhavati phenād aṇḍaṃ bhavaty aṇḍād brahmā bhavati brahmaṇo vāyuḥ vāyor oṃkāraḥ
analyzed: phenam bhavati phenāt aṇḍam bhavati aṇḍāt brahmā bhavati brahmaṇaḥ vāyuḥ vāyoḥ oṃkāraḥ
translated: froth arises. From froth, an egg arises. From the egg, Brahmā arises. From Brahmā, Vāyu. From Vāyu, the syllable Om.

original: oṃkārāt sāvitrī sāvitryā gāyatrī gāyatryā lokā bhavanti /
analyzed: oṃkārāt sāvitrī sāvitryāḥ gāyatrī gāyatryāḥ lokāḥ bhavanti
translated: From the syllable Om, the Gāyatrī. From the Gāyatrī, the world arises.

original: arcayanti tapaḥ satyaṃ madhu kṣaranti yad dhruvam /
analyzed: arcayanti tapaḥ satyam madhu kṣaranti yat dhruvam
translated: They worship austerity, truth, and the ever-flowing honey.

original: etaddhi paramaṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: etat hi paramam tapaḥ
translated: This is the highest austerity.

original: āpo jyotī raso 'mṛtaṃ brahma bhūr bhuvaḥ svar oṃ nama iti //
analyzed: āpaḥ jyotiḥ rasaḥ mṛtam brahma bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar om namaḥ iti
translated: Water, light, essence, nectar, Brahman, earth, atmosphere, heaven, Om, salutations.

original: ya idam atharvaśiro brāhmaṇo 'dhīte aśrotriyaḥ śrotriyo bhavati anupanīta upanīto
analyzed: yaḥ idam atharvaśiraḥ brāhmaṇaḥ dhīte aśrotriyaḥ śrotriyaḥ bhavati anupanītaḥ upanītaḥ
translated: The Brahmin who studies this head of the Atharvaveda, though unlearned, becomes learned, though uninitiated, becomes initiated.

original: bhavati so 'gnipūto bhavati sa vāyupūto bhavati sa sūryapūto bhavati sa somapūto
analyzed: bhavati saḥ agni pūtaḥ bhavati sa vāyu pūtaḥ bhavati sa sūrya pūtaḥ bhavati sa soma pūtaḥ
translated: He becomes purified by fire, purified by Vāyu, purified by the sun, purified by Soma,

original: bhavati sa satyapūto bhavati sa sarvair devair jñāto bhavati sa sarvair vedair anudhyāto
analyzed: bhavati sa satya pūtaḥ bhavati sa sarvaiḥ devaiḥ jñātaḥ bhavati sa sarvaiḥ vedaiḥ anudhyātaḥ
translated: purified by truth, known by all gods, contemplated by all Vedas,

original: bhavati sa sarveṣu tīrtheṣu snāto bhavati tena sarvaiḥ kratubhir iṣṭaṃ bhavati gāyatryāḥ🔽ṣaṣṭisahasrāṇi japtāni bhavanti itihāsapurāṇānāṃ rudrāṇāṃ śatasahasrāṇi japtāni bhavanti /
analyzed: bhavati sa sarveṣu tīrtheṣu snātaḥ bhavati tena sarvaiḥ kratubhiḥ iṣṭam bhavati gāyatryāḥ  ṣaṣṭi sahasrāṇi japtāni bhavanti itihāsa purāṇānām rudrāṇām śata sahasrāṇi japtāni bhavanti
translated: He becomes one who has bathed in all the holy places, he becomes one who has performed all the sacrifices, the Gayatri🔽has been recited by him sixty thousand times, the Itihasa-Puranas and the Rudras have been recited by him a hundred thousand times.

original: praṇavānām ayutaṃ japtaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: praṇavānām ayutam japtam bhavati
translated: Ten thousand Pranavas have been recited by him.

original: sa cakṣuṣaḥ paṅktiṃ punāti /
analyzed: sa cakṣuṣaḥ paṅktim punāti
translated: And he purifies the line up to the seventh generation.

original: ā saptamāt puruṣayugān punātīty āha bhagavān atharvaśiraḥ sakṛj japtvaiva śuciḥ sa pūtaḥ karmaṇyo bhavati /
analyzed: ā saptamāt puruṣa yugān punāti iti āha bhagavān atharvaśiraḥ sakṛt japtvā eva śuciḥ sa pūtaḥ karmaṇyaḥ bhavati
translated: The Blessed Lord says that he purifies up to the seventh generation of men. Having recited the Atharva-Shira once, he becomes pure, purified, and fit for ritual action.

original: dvitīyaṃ japtvā gaṇādhipatyam āpnoti /
analyzed: dvitīyam japtvā gaṇa ādhipatyam āpnoti
translated: By reciting it a second time, he attains lordship over the Ganas.

original: tṛtīyaṃ japtvaivam evānupraviśaty oṃ satyam oṃ satyam oṃ satyam /
analyzed: tṛtīyam japtvā evam eva anupraviśati om satyam om satyam om satyam
translated: By reciting it a third time, he enters in the same way. Om truth, Om truth, Om truth.

original: ity atharvavede śiraupaniṣat samāptā //
analyzed: iti atharvavede śiraupaniṣad samāptā
translated: Thus ends the Upanishad called Shira in the Atharva Veda.
